Description: Rim sherd of East Greek pottery bird bowl; interior painted black with red band lined in white; exterior: black band at top of rim; below from left, vertical band; pendant triangle as filling ornament; part of a bird (head missing; lozenge decoration on body) to right; below, tip of one rising ray.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1209)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 74, Nau 12, pl. 3d)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (35, pl. 18, 2)
